oracle.mapviewer.share.style
Class MarkerStyleModel

java.lang.Object
  oracle.mapviewer.share.style.AbstractStyleModel
      oracle.mapviewer.share.style.MarkerStyleModel
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, StyleModel
public class MarkerStyleModel
extends AbstractStyleModel

Represents the data model for a MapViewer MARKER style.

See Also:
Serialized Form

toXMLString

public java.lang.String toXMLString()
This method, when implemented by an extended class, creates a string that contains the XML representation of this style bean. This XML document can then be saved to the DEFINITION column of the USER_SDO_STYLES table.

Returns:
String - an XML string containing the definition of this style

setMarkerType

public void setMarkerType(int markerType)
Sets the marker type: MARKER_POLYGON - for polygons (closed vector with X,Y coordinates) MARKER_POLYLINE - for line (vector with X,Y coordinates) MARKER_CIRCLE - for circles MARKER_RECT - for rectangle MARKER_IMAGE - for image marker MARKER_TTF - for Truetype font

Parameters:
markerType - - marker type

setMarkerSize

public void setMarkerSize(SizeDefinition2D size)
Sets the marker size (width and height) with unit. If unit is null, pixel ("px") unit is assumed. Size with metric units are used to define scalable styles. Int his case, the marker size changes as zoom in and zoom out operations are performed.

Parameters:
size - - marker size with unit

getMarkerSize

public SizeDefinition2D getMarkerSize()
Returns the marker size (width and height) with unit.

Returns:
SizeDefinition2D - marker size with unit

setVector

public void setVector(double[] vector)
Sets the vector coordinates (applies to polygons, lines, circles and rectangles). These coordinates have no unit and MapViewer will scale if needed. For polygons and lines pass a vector with values for X1,Y1,X2,Y2,... For circles pass a vector with one position: the radius value. For rectangle pass a vector with 4 elements: X,Y,width,height

Parameters:
vector - - array of coordinates

getVector

public double[] getVector()
Returns the vector marker coordinates.

Returns:
double[] - vector coordinates

setOrientation

public double setOrientation(double x,
                             double y,
                             double z)
Sets up the orientation of the marker when applied. The marker will be rotated to align with the normalized vector (x,y,z), where x,y and z are in the range [-1, 1]. The values must be in the user space, not the device (screen) coordinate system.
Note: No rotation will be applied if y=0 and x>=0 (point x,y is on the x-axis).
For this release the z value will be ignored.

Parameters:
x - - X orientation
y - - Y orientation
z - - Z orientation
Returns:
double - the angle to be rotated, in radian

getOrientation

public double[] getOrientation()
Returns the currently set orientation vector. Default is (1, 0, 0).

Returns:
double[] - an array of 3 doubles corresponding to (x,y,z).

resetOrientation

public void resetOrientation()
Resets the marker orientation to 0.

setLabelOffsetSize

public void setLabelOffsetSize(SizeDefinition2D size)
Sets the in-marker label text's X and Y offset from the marker center. The default value is 0, meaning for the label text drawn inside the marker, its center x coincides with that of the marker. Posive offset shifts the text to the right of marker center, while negative shifts to left when displayed.

Parameters:
size - - size offset of the in-marker text from marker center, default unit is pixel

getLabelOffsetSize

public SizeDefinition2D getLabelOffsetSize()
Returns the in-marker label text's X and Y offset from the marker center with unit.

Returns:
SizeDefinition2D - label offset with unit

Returns the in-marker label text's X offset from the marker center.

double label X offset from marker center

getLabelOffsetUnit

public java.lang.String getLabelOffsetUnit()
Returns the label text's X,Y offset unit.

Returns:
String - unit name

setLabelOffsetUnit

public void setLabelOffsetUnit(java.lang.String unit)
Sets the label text's X,Y offset unit. Null unit means pixels ("px").

Parameters:
unit - - unit name

setLabelOffsetX

public void setLabelOffsetX(int labelOffsetX)
Sets the in-marker label text's X offset from the marker center. The default value is 0, meaning for the label text drawn inside the marker, its center x coincides with that of the marker. Posive offset shifts the text to the right of marker center, while negative shifts to left when displayed. This method may be deprecated in the future. The method with double value is more generic, in order to support values with units. Should use method setLabelOffsetSizeX.

Parameters:
labelOffsetX - - x offset of the in-marker text from marker center

getLabelOffsetX

public int getLabelOffsetX()
Returns the in-marker label text's X offset from the marker center. This method may be deprecated in the future. Use method that returns a double value.

Returns:
int - label X offset value

setLabelOffsetY

public void setLabelOffsetY(int labelOffsetY)
Sets the in-marker label text's Y offset from the marker center. The default value is 0, meaning for the label text drawn inside the marker, its center y coincides with that of the marker. Posive offset shifts the text to the up-side of marker center, while negative shifts to down-side when displayed. This method may be deprecated in the future. The method with double value is more generic, in order to support values with units. Should use method setLabelOffsetSizeY.

Parameters:
labelOffsetY - - y offset of the in-marker text from marker center, in pixel

getLabelOffsetY

public int getLabelOffsetY()
Returns the in-marker label text's Y offset from the marker center. This method may be deprecated in the future. Use method that returns a double value.

Returns:
int - label Y offset value

setUrl

public void setUrl(java.lang.String param)
Sets the URL for an image that is to be used as the marker.

Parameters:
param - - a valid url that points to an online image.
